thread.title: Lakers' Luol Deng expands on comments about refugees in wake of Donald Trump order
thread.title_full: Lakers' Luol Deng expands on comments about refugees in wake of Donald Trump order

author: Tom Gatto (tgatto@sportingnews.com)
title: Lakers' Luol Deng expands on comments about refugees in wake of Donald Trump order
text:
— Lakers Outsiders (@LakersOutsiders) February 1, 2017 
National security is cited as the primary reason for Trump's order. Deng said (per the Los Angeles Times' Baxter Holmes ), "From what I understand, I haven’t seen a lot of refugees committing terrorist acts in this country." 
Deng, 31, and his family fled a civil war in Sudan when he was 3. They were granted asylum in the States when Deng was a teenager. A few years later, he was starring at Duke en route to becoming an NBA player. 
On Monday, Deng offered his moral support to refugees. 
"I stand by all refugees and migrants, of all religions, just as I stand by the policies that have historically welcomed them," Deng wrote. Watch This
